title: Political Cartoon Controversy
name: Political Cartoon Controversy
description:
A Map by Summer

Mapping the Political Cartoon Controversy based on Reuters chronology. Other Platial members are welcome to add images of events as they arise and to discuss at will. Map is best viewed zoomed out and on satellite view!

properties.name: Danish Prime Minister says he cannot act against cartoons January 29
properties.description: Posted by SummerFrom Reuters: Jan 29 - Danish Prime Minister Anders Fogh Rasmussen says his government cannot act against the cartoons.

properties.name: Denmark (Jyllands-Posten newspaper)
properties.description: Posted by SummerFrom Reuters: The cartoons, one of which showed the Prophet Mohammad with a turban resembling a bomb, were first published by the Danish Jyllands-Posten newspaper last September.

properties.name: Feb 4, Demonstrators set fire to Danish and Norwegian embassies
properties.description: Posted by SummerdamascusFrom Reuters: Feb 4 - Several thousand demonstrators set fire to the Danish and the Norwegian embassies in Damascus.

properties.name: Feb 5, Demonstrators set fire to the Dan
properties.description: Posted by Summer From Reuters: Feb 5 - Demonstrators set fire to the Danish and Norwegian embassies in Beirut. One protester, trapped by flames, dies jumping from the building. Lebanese Interior Minister Hassan al-Sabaa resigns.

properties.name: Feb 6, 200 people pelt embassy of EU President with perol bombs
properties.description: Posted by SummertehranFrom Reuters: Feb 6 - In the Iranian capital, Tehran, about 200 people pelt the embassy of EU president Austria with petrol bombs. -- Iran cuts all trade ties with Denmark because of the cartoons, Iranian Commerce Minister Massoud Mirkazemi is quoted as saying by student news agency ISNA.

properties.name: Feb 6, Newspaper in Ukraine publishes cartoons
properties.description: Posted by SummerukraineFrom Reuters: Feb 6-- A newspaper in Ukraine publishes the cartoons, joining others in Denmark, Norway, France, Bulgaria, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, Hungary, Poland, the United States, Japan, the Netherlands, Malaysia, New Zealand and Australia.

properties.name: Feb 8, Several Hundred March in Dhaka
properties.description: Posted by SummerdhakaSeveral hundred people march on the Italian embassy in the Bangladeshi capital Dhaka, but are blocked by police

properties.name: Feb 8th, Chirac Condemns Media
properties.description: Posted by SummerFeb 8- hirac has condemned as "overt provocation" decisions to reprint cartoons satirising the Prophet Muhammad.

properties.name: French newspaper reprints the cartoons F
properties.description: Posted by SummerFrom Reuters: Feb 1 - Newspapers in France and Germany reprint the cartoons, saying press freedom is more important than protests.

properties.name: German newspaper reprints cartoon February 1
properties.description: Posted by SummerFrom Reuters: German newspaper reprints cartoons on February 1

properties.name: Jordan, Editor of Shihan Weekly dismissed
properties.description: Posted by SummerjordanFrom Reuters: - In Jordan, the editor of the Shihan weekly is dismissed by the paper\'s publishers hours after it carried the cartoons.

properties.name: Jyllands-Posten issues an apology January 30
properties.description: Posted by SummerFrom Reuters: Jan 30 - The Danish newspaper Jyllands-Posten issues an apology

properties.name: Norway, Christian Magazinet newspaper in Oslo, which reprinted the cartoons, says he regrets publication
properties.description: Posted by SummerFeb 3 - Vebjoen Selbekk, editor of the Christian Magazinet newspaper in Oslo, which reprinted the cartoons, says he regrets publication. He says he has received dozens of death threats.

properties.name: Palestinian Protestor's in Hebron Feb 7-8
properties.description: Posted by Summer Hebron, Palestine Feb 7-8: About 300 Palestinian protesters attack an international observers\' mission in the West Bank town of Hebron, throwing rocks and bottles and trying to torch one of its buildings.

properties.name: Protests in Afghanistan Feb 8
properties.description: Posted by Summer AfghanistanFeb 8th- The deaths - at a protest by about 400 people in the town of Qalat - bring to 12 the number of people killed in Afghan protests over the cartoons in recent days.

properties.name: Rampage in the lobby of the Danish embas
properties.description: Posted by Summerjakarta From reuters: Up to 300 militant Indonesian Muslims go on a rampage in the lobby of a building housing the Danish embassy in Jakarta.

properties.name: Saudi Arabia: Boycott of Danish dairy products January 26, 2006
properties.description: Posted by SummerSaudi ArabiaFrom Reuters: Jan 26 - Muslim anger over the cartoons sparks a boycott of Danish dairy products in Saudi Arabia.

properties.name: Thousands Demonstrate in Pakistan
properties.description: Posted by SummerDara Adam Khel, PakistanThousands demonstrate in Pakistan\'s Dara Adam Khel tribal region, bordering Afghanistan
